stem: In a patient with appendicitis, which of the following is the most helpful finding to make a diagnosis?
disc: In approximately 80% of patients with appendicitis, there is leukocytosis and left shift. The sensitivity and specificity of an elevated white blood cell (WBC) count in acute appendicitis are 80 percent and 55 percent respectively. Therefore, acute appendicitis is less likely when the WBC is normal except for early in the disease.
